content.description: Excellent route.  The crux is around the first few bolts.  Once you get around the bulge, the climb eases significantly.  Around 2-3 bolts through the lower angle terrain veer left on a separate bolt line.  Follow this straight to the top.  Going straight/right at the y finishes on different anchors (12b).  This is a tall route.  Be careful while lowering.
content.location: The route is to the left of 'Ape Arms'.  As of 7/25/2012, the climb was marked with a 'Y' at the bottom with the 12b(right) and 12a (left) lines marked.  'Ape Arms' was also marked for reference.  The climb starts on the lower tier (5 feet below the main ledge).

content.description: Start on zurkinkfas left then 2/3rds up branch out right. On sloping holds smear feet and big reaches. Hard if you are short.

Power through

Sharin' Stone

and then pull the moves through the upper roof.
content.location:
This is the extension of of

Sharin' Stone.

content.description:
Excellent. This starts in an obvious corner with laybacks and tension movements to a shake out above the dihedral section.  The crux lurks around the long chain draw and pulls small crimps with smaller feet. A longer pull to a hold under the roof, then naviage the roof and finish in the in dihedral.

Trad climbers often find this to be an easier route.

This route has gotten harder due to holds breaking and being shot off by rednecks.
content.location: Located in the center of the wall.

content.description:
Fun climb with obvious crux around bolts 5-6. Line of bolts climbs into large corner system providing good shakes and rests. Soft for the grade.  Shares anchors with

Sharin'Stone

.
content.location: This is the farthest right climb on the upper tier.

content.description:
Excellent climb with varied movement that uses blocks, pinches, crimps to a fun, pumpy finish.

This route was originally done without resting or using the holds

Redneck Rampage

(bolt line to the right). Without the rests, it was thought to be 13b; however, the current path of least resistance involves stepping over to the rests on

Redneck Rampage

which results in an easier experience and a grade of 13a.
content.location:
Middle of the wall. Left of

Redneck Rampage

.
On the far left side of wall behind some trees.

content.description: Start with technical stemming in a right facing corner which is surprisingly strenuous, make a delicate traverse and launch up underclings and edges to the finish.  The technical crux is down low in the corner while the redpoint crux is up high clipping the chains.
content.location:
The right facing corner directly across from

Sans Nom

(Left facing corner) located below the large roof.

content.description:
Start on

Green Bolts

and then continue through the large roof capping the wall.

Consensus needed on grade, so go get it and comment back.
content.location: This is an extension of Green bolts

content.description:
This climb starts in corner system and follows the obvious weakness. Although the rock looks broken, it is an excellent climb.

Finish feels a little spicy until you know which crimps are the good ones to use.

The guidebook shows the order of Groover and Hellbound incorrectly-

Hellbound is the most left route on the wall and Groover is the 2nd.
content.location: Located on the left side of wall and starts near a small boulder.

content.description:
Climbs the section of rock left of

Classic Blues

. Technical and cryptic climbing for the first half of route, which is the crux.  Finishes on the

Classic Blues

anchor.

Due to nature of rock and movement, the climbing is a little heady between bolts 2-4.  Plus this is a brand new climb (9/30/2012)and a little chossy. Climb cautiously.

Also, need consensus on the grade.

This route is also called Unknown and it may have been the first line bolted on the cliff (bolted by D.Bell?)  This climb follows a shallow corner system with technical movement. Bouldery crux to pull the roof followed by moves on pinches.

No history known of FA. In 2009, R.Otto and C.Grihalva sent it and nicknamed it Classic Blues for the blue streak on the rock.
content.location:
To the left of

Green Bolts

. Climbs an obvious blue streak.

content.description: Easier climbing takes you to the large arete about 75 feet up. The longer your ape index, the easier it is to span the distance around the arete and pull the crux moves.
content.location: First route on the right hand side of wall.
